author: Special Correspondent
text:
More than 30,000 students, including 16,598 girls appeared for State board Plus Two examinations in the two districts on Friday amid tight vigil and regulations by the Education department.

A total of 14,536 students, including 7,753 girls from the two educational districts of Ramanathapuram and Paramakudi appeared for the examinations in 47 centres in the district, while 15,954 students, including 8,845 girls appeared for the examination in 54 centres in Sivaganga district.

Collector S. Natarajan visited the Schwartz Higher Secondary School and inspected the arrangements and his Sivaganga counterpart, S Malarvizhi visited an examination hall at Sivaganga Mannar Higher Secondary School.

The districts’ administration and the Education departments in the two districts made arrangements for uninterrupted power supply and drinking water facilities at the examination halls. At many centres, students offered prayers before entering the examination halls.

More than 2,000 teachers acted as invigilators and members of about 150 stationary and mobile squads visited the centres to prevent any malpractice. Special arrangements were made for visually impaired and differently abled students. Ramanathapuram Chief Educational Officer (CEO) Jayakannu and Sivaganga CEO Senthivelmurugan supervised the arrangements.
title: Plus Two examinations conducted amidst tight vigil
